answers.answer: I'm in the same boat as you.  I'm 27 and was diagnosed with pre-type1 diabetes at age 25.  I have normal fasting bg, but have many highs and lows in blood sugar through out the day.  Excessive thirst and urinating is a likely indicator of diabetes.  Type 1 can be diagnosed from adolescence into young adulthood, according to what I have found in research and with an endocrinologist (diabetic specialist).  I've also had high levels of glucose in my urine.  Do you have that problem?  I would try to get in with a diabetic doctor for further testing.

question: I'm wondering if anyone can help me out.  I've read about diabetes online and am familiar with the symptoms.  I'm not experiencing all of the symptoms but do have a few.  My main symptom is that I am ALWAYS thirsty and urinate A LOT - like probably more than once an hour sometimes.  If I am at a meeting for an hour at work, I have to bring water with me or I am extremely thirsty by the end.A little history - I'm 25 years old.  I've had GI problems for 5 or 6 years; I've had lots of different tests done....they never found anything besides some ulcers a few years ago and gastritis (chronic inflammation of the stomach lining).  I felt so sick and nobody could tell me any answers so I decided to go gluten free about 5 months ago.  It has definitely worked!!  I feel soooo much better.  All of my GI symptoms have subsided, but I still get unquenchable thirst.  That is the only symptom that hasn't gone away.  I am very healthy besides my stomach problems.  I work out at least 4 times per week and eat lots of fruits and veggies.  I'm a healthy weight (138ish) 5'4''....if anything I probably need to lose a few haha.  I know weight loss is a sign of diabetes...I'm not losing any weight though.  I'm not sure if maintaining a healthy lifestyle affects symptoms of diabetes?My question is, can Type I diabetes show up as late as 25 years?  What are some of the early signs?  My doctor ordered some blood work which included a fasting blood sugar test.  I got that done a few days ago, so I'm awaiting the results.  I'm just wondering what you all think, while I wait to hear back from my doctor.  Thanks for reading this novel!!!
title: early signs of diabetes?
